metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: Learn how to style buttons using CSS.
content.html: Learn how to style buttons using CSS.

content.code_html:
.button {
  background-color: #04AA6D; /* Green */
  border: none;
  color: white;
  padding: 15px 32px;
  text-align: center;
  text-decoration: none;
  display: inline-block;
  font-size: 16px;
}

content.text: Use the background-color property to change the background color of a button:
content.html: Use the background-color property to change the background color of a button:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
.button1 {background-color: #04AA6D;} /* Green */.button2 
{background-color: #008CBA;} /* Blue */.button3 {background-color: 
#f44336;} /* Red */ 
.button4 {background-color: #e7e7e7; color: black;} /* Gray */ .button5 
{background-color: #555555;} /* Black */

{background-color: #008CBA;} /* Blue */.button3 {background-color:
#f44336;} /* Red */
.button4 {background-color: #e7e7e7; color: black;} /* Gray */ .button5
{background-color: #555555;} /* Black */

.button4 {background-color: #e7e7e7; color: black;} /* Gray */ .button5

.button1 {background-color: #04AA6D;} /* Green */
.button2 {background-color: #008CBA;} /* Blue */
.button3 {background-color: #f44336;} /* Red */
.button4 {background-color: #e7e7e7; color: black;} /* Gray */
.button5 {background-color: #555555;} /* Black */

{background-color: #008CBA;} /* Blue */.button3 {background-color:

content.text: Use the font-size property to change the font size of a button:
content.html: Use the font-size property to change the font size of a button:

content.code_html:
.button1 {font-size: 10px;}
.button2 {font-size: 12px;}
.button3 {font-size: 16px;}
.button4 {font-size: 20px;}
.button5 {font-size: 24px;}

content.text: Use the padding property to change the padding of a button:
content.html: Use the padding property to change the padding of a button:

content.code_html:
.button1 {padding: 10px 24px;}
.button2 {padding: 12px 28px;}
.button3 {padding: 14px 40px;}
.button4 {padding: 32px 16px;}
.button5 {padding: 16px;}

content.text: Use the border-radius property to add rounded corners to a button:
content.html: Use the border-radius property to add rounded corners to a button:

content.code_html:
.button1 {border-radius: 2px;}
.button2 {border-radius: 4px;}
.button3 {border-radius: 8px;}
.button4 {border-radius: 12px;}
.button5 {border-radius: 50%;}

content.text: Use the border property to add a colored border to a button:
content.html: Use the border property to add a colored border to a button:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
.button1 {  background-color: white;  color: black;  
border: 2px solid #04AA6D; /* Green */}...

background-color: white;  color: black;  
border: 2px solid #04AA6D; /* Green */

content.code:
.button1 {  background-color: white;  color: black;
border: 2px solid #04AA6D; /* Green */}...

border: 2px solid #04AA6D; /* Green */}...

border: 2px solid #04AA6D; /* Green */

.button1 {
  background-color: white;

  border: 2px solid #04AA6D; /* Green */
}
...

border: 2px solid #04AA6D; /* Green */}...

background-color: white;  color: black;  
border: 2px solid #04AA6D; /* Green */

content.text: Use the :hover selector to change the style of a button when you move the mouse over it.
content.html: Use the :hover selector to change the style of a button when you move the mouse over it.

content.text: Tip: Use the transition-duration property to determine the speed of the "hover" effect:
content.html: Tip: Use the transition-duration property to determine the speed of the "hover" effect:

content.code_html:
.button {
  transition-duration: 0.4s;
}

.button:hover {
  background-color: #04AA6D; /* Green */
  color: white;
}
...

content.text: Use the box-shadow property to add shadows to a button:
content.html: Use the box-shadow property to add shadows to a button:

content.code_html:
.button1 {
  box-shadow: 0 8px 16px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.2), 0 6px 20px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.19);
}

.button2:hover {
  box-shadow: 0 12px 16px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.24), 0 17px 50px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.19);
}

content.text: Use the opacity property to add transparency to a button (creates a "disabled" look).
content.html: Use the opacity property to add transparency to a button (creates a "disabled" look).

content.text: Tip: You can also add the cursor property with a value of "not-allowed", which will display a "no parking sign" when you mouse over the button:
content.html: Tip: You can also add the cursor property with a value of "not-allowed", which will display a "no parking sign" when you mouse over the button:

content.code_html:
.disabled {
  opacity: 0.6;
  cursor: not-allowed;
}

content.text: By default, the size of the button is determined by its text content (as wide as its content). Use the width property to change the width of a button:
content.html: By default, the size of the button is determined by its text content (as wide as its content). Use the width property to change the width of a button:

content.code_html:
.button1 {width: 250px;}
.button2 {width: 50%;}
.button3 {width: 100%;}

content.text: Remove margins and add float:left to each button to create a button group:
content.html: Remove margins and add float:left to each button to create a button group:

content.code_html:
.button {
  float: left;
}

content.text: Use the border property to create a bordered button group:
content.html: Use the border property to create a bordered button group:

content.code_html:
.button {
  float: left;
  border: 1px solid green;
}

content.text: Use display:block instead of float:left to group the buttons below each other, instead of side by side:
content.html: Use display:block instead of float:left to group the buttons below each other, instead of side by side:

content.code_html:
.button {
  display: block;
}
